newsitem.title: GERMANY: Sixt plans joint-venture with Eurorent SA.
newsitem.headline: Sixt plans joint-venture with Eurorent SA.

text.p: German car rental firm Sixt AG said on Monday that it is planning a joint-venture with the French group Eurorent SA, which will have potential sales of 200 million marks a year.
The joint-venture company will be called Sixt Eurorent S.A.S. and means Sixt can operate through Eurorent's 100 licencees.
Sixt said in a mandatory statement that it expected the venture to break even this year.
"The opening of business in France is another step in our expansion programme aimed at setting up a network of car rental agencies in Europe," Sixt said.
